meanings.definition: To fill with spirit or courage.
meanings.sent1: The coach inspirited the team before the big game.
meanings.sent2: The kind words from her friend inspirited her during a difficult time.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics inspirited the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful sunrise inspirited a sense of hope in the weary traveler.
meanings.sent5: The music inspirited the crowd, lifting their spirits.

meanings.sent1: The colorful decorations inspirited the party atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The children's laughter inspirited the quiet library.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist inspirited the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes inspirited the dull canvas.
meanings.sent5: The fresh breeze inspirited the stagnant room.

meanings.sent1: Her success story inspirited others to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's words of wisdom inspirited the students to work harder.
meanings.sent3: The challenge of the race inspirited the runners to push themselves.
meanings.sent4: The supportive community inspirited him to overcome his fears.
meanings.sent5: The inspiring movie inspirited him to make positive changes in his life.
